snippet: Owners of vehicles recalled over a faulty, and deadly, ignition switch problem say they are still waiting for repairs and sometimes get the runaround at dealerships.
abstract: Owners of General Motors vehicles recalled over faulty ignition switch say they are still waiting for repairs nearly nine months after company began recalling millions of its cars; while GM faces multiple investigations over its decade-long delay in ordering recall, less attention has been paid to company's oversight of recall itself and critical task of fixing 2.36 million cars that it estimates are still in use.

byline.original: By HILARY STOUT and REBECCA R. RUIZ

lead_paragraph: Owners of vehicles recalled over a faulty, and deadly, ignition switch problem say they are still waiting for repairs and sometimes get the runaround at dealerships.

headline.print_headline: Over One Million Cars Recalled by G.M. Still Await Defect Fix
